Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Row.Hidden always reads first sheet" (#600) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "WorkbookProtection corrupts Spreadsheet for Excel 2019" (#601) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Spreadsheets saved with Excel 2019 get corrupted as soon as you add a WorkbookProtection. Files saved with Excel 2010 are not affected.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET 3.5
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.9.1, 2.10.0-beta0001

**Repro**

Create an empty spreadsheet in Excel 2019 and perform the following operation:

```csharp
using (var document = SpreadsheetDocument.Open("...", true) {
  document.WorkbookPart.Workbook.WorkbookProtection = new WorkbookProtection();
}
``` 

**Observed**

Excel fails to open and repair the file.

![Exception](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/145854/41104354-74e23734-6a6b-11e8-856f-184535172d76.png)

The resulting workbook.xml contains the newly added `x:workbookProtection` followed by the `x:revisionPtr`. 

```xml
<x:workbookProtection />
<xr:revisionPtr revIDLastSave="0" documentId="13_ncr:1_{4BF1E7C4-2F1B-4756-81DA-B102ED8D212D}" xr6:coauthVersionLast="36" xr6:coauthVersionMax="36" xr10:uidLastSave="{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}" />
```

Manually changing the order (unzip/edit/zip) repairs the file.

```xml
<xr:revisionPtr revIDLastSave="0" documentId="13_ncr:1_{4BF1E7C4-2F1B-4756-81DA-B102ED8D212D}" xr6:coauthVersionLast="36" xr6:coauthVersionMax="36" xr10:uidLastSave="{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}" />
<x:workbookProtection />

```

 `x:revisionPtr` was introduced in Office 2016 so this might explain why files saved in Excel 2010 are not affected.

**Expected**

File should not get corrupted.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Row.Hidden always reads first sheet" (#600) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Incorporate Open XML Power Tools in base SDK" (#599) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Before submitting an issue, please fill this out

Is this a:
- [ ] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [X] Question on library usage


**Open XML Power tool features in base SDK**

Open XML Power tools had perfect tools that is was very helpful but, Microsoft decided to kill that product. Is it any plan to incorporate that functionality in this SDK ? and support them/

It would be really nice to be.
